whole_object: This room's so sunny, even the flowers are trying to put down roots on the table, while the chairs are just lounging around!
single_object:
- Table: "I told the table to stand up for itself, but it just couldn't find its legs!"
- Lamp: "Why did the lamp break up with the light bulb? It found someone who really brightened its day!"
- Flowers: "These flowers are so vibrant, they must have taken a few selfies in the sun!"
- Sofa: "The sofa is so comfortable, it should really consider a career in relaxation therapy!"
- Cushions: "These cushions are like comedians; they always know how to lighten the mood!"
- Books: "These books are so well-read, they should start charging for their life advice!"
- Glasses: "These glasses are always looking for a good time, but they just can't seem to focus!"
- Tray: "The tray is feeling a bit flat; it just wants to elevate its serving game!"
- Curtains: "These curtains are so dramatic, they could win an Oscar for best performance in a living room!"
- Door: "The door is always open to new opportunities, but it really hates being pushed around!"
- Mirror: "The mirror is a real narcissist; it just can't stop reflecting on itself!"
- Chair: "This chair is so supportive, it should consider a career in counseling!"
multi_object:
- Table  
- Lamp  
- "The table was feeling a bit dim until the lamp decided to brighten up the mood!"  

- Lamp  
- Flowers  
- "The lamp tried to steal the spotlight, but the flowers were blooming with confidence!"  

- Flowers  
- Sofa  
- "The flowers were so vibrant that even the sofa felt like it needed a makeover!"  

- Sofa  
- Cushions  
- "The sofa and cushions were in a heated debate about who was more comfortable—spoiler alert: it was a soft landing!"  

- Cushions  
- Books  
- "The cushions were so fluffy that the books were jealous they couldn't take a nap!"  

- Books  
- Glasses  
- "The books were feeling a little blurry until the glasses showed up to help them focus!"  

- Glasses  
- Tray  
- "The glasses were ready for a toast, but the tray was just trying to keep it all together!"  

- Tray  
- Curtains  
- "The tray was feeling a bit exposed until the curtains swooped in for a dramatic cover-up!"  

- Curtains  
- Door  
- "The curtains were always ready to make a grand entrance, but the door just wanted to keep things on the down-low!"  

- Door  
- Mirror  
- "The door thought it was the entrance to a grand adventure, but the mirror just reflected on its past!"  

- Mirror  
- Chair  
- "The mirror was always reflecting on its life choices, while the chair just wanted to take a seat and relax!"  

- Chair  
- Table  
- "The chair was tired of being overlooked, so it decided to pull up to the table and join the conversation!"
